definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: strip off, make a dash, raid (cf. As. pašâṭu, expunge, obliterate; NH [[פָּשַׁט]] Aram. [[פְּשַׁט]], p4at., are stretch out, extend, make plain, so Ar. basat.a);—

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Pf. 3 ms. ´[[פ]] Ho 7:1 +, 2 ms. [[וּפָשַׁטְדָמתּ֫]] Ju Jdg 9:33, etc.; Impf. 3 ms. [[וַיִפְשַׁט]] 1Sa 19:24; 3 mpl. [[יִפְשָׁׂטוּ]] Ez Eze 26:1, etc.; Imv. ms. [[פְּשׁׂ֫טָה]] Is 32:11; Pt. pl. [[פּשְׁטִים]] Ne 4:17; —

strip off, put off, one's garment (acc.) 1Sa 19:24, Ez Eze 26:16, Le 6:4 (opp. [[לָבַשׁ]]), Le 16:23 (id.; both P), Ne 4:17, Ct So 5:3; acc. om. Is 32:11; of locusts Na 3:16 stripping off (sheaths of wings, cf. Da Dr Am 85).

put off (one's shelter), i.e. make a dash (from a sheltered place), c. [[אֶל]] Ju Jdg 20:37, abs. Jdg 9:44; esp. of marauding foray Ho 7:1, c [[עַל]] against Ju Jdg 9:33, Jdg 9:44, 1Sa 23:27, 1Sa 30:14 (ins. [[עַל]] cf. Lxx We Dr al), Job 1:17 c [[אֶל]] 1Sa 27:8, 1Sa 30:1, c. [[בְּ]] 1Ch 14:9, 1Ch 14:13, 2Ch 25:13, 2Ch 28:18; in 1Sa 27:10 rd. [[אָן]] (for [[אַל־]]) We Dr al.

definitions.title: Pi.
definitions.body: inf. cstr.[[לְפַשֵּׁט]], c. acc. pers. 1Sa 31:8 to strip the slain = 1Ch 10:8; abs. only to strip (sc. the slain) 2Sa 23:10 (ins. also ‖ 1Ch 11:13 Dr).

definitions.title: Hiph.
definitions.body: Pf. 3 ms [[הִפְשִׁיט]] Job 19:9; 3 mpl. sf. [[וְהִפְשִׁיטוח]] Ez Eze 23:26 etc.; Impf. 3 ms [[וַיַּפְשֵׁט]] Nu 20:28; 1 s. sf. [[אַפְשִׁיטֶנׇּה]] Ho 2:5; 2 mpl. [[תַּפְשִׁטָוּן]] Mic 2:8, etc.; Imv. [[הַפְשֵׁט]] Nu 20:26; Inf. cstr. [[הַפְשִׁיט]] 2Ch 29:34; Pt. pl. [[מַפְשִׁיטִים]] 2Ch 35:11; —
strip one of garment (2 acc.) Ge 37:23 (E), Nu 20:26, Nu 20:28 (opp. [[הִלְבִּישׁ]]), Ez Eze 16:39, Eze 23:26; a. acc. pers. alone 1Ch 10:9; Ho 2:5 strip her (sf.) naked ([[עֲרֻמָּה]]).
strip off, acc. [[כֵּלָיו]]1Sa 31:9, clothing Job 22:6; c. acc. [[אֶדֶר]] + [[מִטּוּל]]Mic 2:8; c. acc. [[עוֹר]] + [[מֵעַל]] Mic 3:3, cf. (acc. [[כְּבוֹדִי]]) Job 19:9.
flay, c. acc. [[הָעׂלָה]] Le 1:6, 2Ch 29:4; acc. om. 2Ch 35:11.

definitions.title: Hithp.
definitions.body: Impf. 3 ms. [[וַיִּתְפַּשֵּׁט]] 1Sa 18:4 he stripped himself of his garment (acc.).
